name: Albergo Milano Hotel & Apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three wonderful days at the Albergo Milano in early September. Eating breakfast on the deck with a beautiful view over Lake Como was the perfect way to start each day. Dinner by candlelight was even better. We stayed in an appartment a short walk from the main hotel, but it was very comfortable. Our trip took us from Lake Como through Milan, Venice, Florence/Tuscany and Rome - but Varenna, Lake Como, and this room was our favorite location!
reviews.title: Comfortable, Romantic and Perfectly Located!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected this hotel on the basis of the reviews here on TripAdvisor - and we weren't disappointed! As has been mentioned many times before, the service is superb. Egidio's cooking in the restaurant ("La Vista") was wonderful, and he was a very knowledgeable and enthusiastic in helping us to select some great wine to accompany the food.
reviews.title: Ideal base for a stay at Lake Como

reviews.text: We were staying in Casa Rossa, and although the room was small, it was comfortable and the views of the lake were stunning. And other reviewers are spot-on : the trade-off for staying high up in an old building (and those superb views) is the number of steps involved : steps downhill to get to the building, and steps uphill inside the building itself - so pack light!
reviews.title: A small piece of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately for us, it rained for all three days we were there, so I guess that means we'll have to come back when it is nice and sunny! Won't be too difficult, as the hotel is very easy to reach - it is only around 1 hr from central Milan via a frequent train service, and Easyjet now fly to Milan direct from Edinburgh.
reviews.title: Heavenly wedding and impeccable service. Thank you!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A return visit to Albergo Milano but a first time visit in Summer. Though the weather in Varenna was unusually warm the ceiling fans and automated awnings did an excellent job of keeping our room comfortable even during the extreme heat of afternoon. The bonus of being on Lake Como in summer was the opportunity to swim in the lake, rent a boat to explore the lake in a different manner than can be done by ferry alone. This visit we bought ferry passes that allowed for travel on the entire distance from Como to Lecco and would heartily encourage anyone staying for more than a day or two to do so. We were there for a week and found something wonderful to do each day. This was in part thanks to the wonderful advice of Bettina and Egi, the owners, who take the time to learn the individual interests of their guests and make suggestions of restaurants and activities that one might not know about on their own or from the standard guidebooks. No visit to Albergo Milano is complete without experiencing a sunset dinner on the restaurant patio overlooking the lake. The scenery is enhanced by the food Egi and his staff create as well as the advice Egi gives about wines to compliment the food. Even if you aren't lucky enough to get a room at Albergo Milano booking a sunset dinner there is a must for enjoying Lake Como and Varenna.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent three nights here in June. We chose Albergo Milano for it's location and view of Lake Come. We were not disappointed. Our room had a frontal view of the lake that could not have been better. Finding the hotel is not easy. Varenna is made for walking, not driving, and finding a parking place is difficult. If you arrive by car it is well worth the 15 euro per day charge to reserve one of the owner's secured parking places.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.text: Once we found the hotel we received a warm welcome from the owner himself, who also helped us to our room. The rooms are small, but not cramped. The bathroom and shower were clean and the bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Loved our Stay at Albergo Milano

reviews.text: We ate dinner at the hotel one night. The menu was reasonably priced and the food was very good. Although Varenna is quite small there is no shortage of places to eat. We had dinner at a different place each night and all were very good.
reviews.title: Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is very good, with a nice selection of meats, cheese, breads, and cereals to eat and juices and coffee or tea to drink.
reviews.title: Absolutely Stunning!
Bellisimo, quiet, and not touristy
reviews.text: You can get to any of the towns on the lake by ferry, which has regular service to and from Varenna. An all day pass is a good way to see several towns if you want, or you can but a ticket for a specific location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had room 4 which had a tiny balcony and a lateral lake view. The furnishings were very basic but the room was spacious, the bed comfortable with nice linens and the bathroom was beautiful with good quality toiletries. A mini fridge and complimentary internet would have been welcome. The internet was costly (€4 for 15 minutes) so we used the tabaccheria in town where you got half an hour for €3,50. As there is no air conditioning we were very fortunate to have breezy, cool nights but there is no way we could stay here in the heat of summer. No fault of Albergo Milano, the view from the bedroom and bathroom windows was disgusting, overlooking what appeared to be a deserted property used to store junk. We closed the shutters which reduced the light in the room but was worth it for the end result and really didn’t cause us any hardship. Breakfast was quite nice, especially the homemade granola, and the view from the bright, cheery room was wonderful. If you are allergic to cats be aware that the resident cat visits the breakfast room daily. Albergo Milano was perfectly located and, although it was a very steep walk up from the lake, this could be circumvented by walking along XX Settembre to the main square and coming back up one of the staircases at that end of town as they were not as steep. Varenna was very old world with long mid-day closing of the shops and dinners not served before 7 pm. We chose Varenna for our visit to Lake Como because of the train station and this turned out to be the perfect location for us. It was also handy to the ferry for our visits to Tremezzo, Bellagio and Lenno. Maybe it was because of the outstanding customer service we had received at the hotels we visited prior to Varenna but we found Management less than helpful and any request was responded to with an air of inconvenience. Marie, who was on duty later in the day was extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great location, not so great hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight, and best meal of our entire trip, was at Il Cavatappi on XX Settembre, very close to Albergo Milano. As this restaurant seats only 12, reservations are a must.
reviews.title: Hotel with a Beautiful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at Victoria Grill in the main square which was okay. We enjoyed a nice meal at Il Molo on the lakefront where we ate indoors as it was very cool and windy. The gelato at Nilus Bar was icy.
reviews.title: We will go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Varenna as our Lake Como base for 3 nights which was a sufficient amount of time. The first day we walked to Castello di Vezio (€3 admission for 60+) which was a very tough 40 minute climb for me and, unless you are very fit and have two good working knees and hips, not something I would recommend. Yes, the views were beautiful but it was quite a challenge. We visited Villa Carlotta on Tremezzo. The day ferry pass was €11 but for €15,70 admission to Villa Carlotta was included. The gate admission is €8,50 so a nice savings when bought in advance. The Villa was lovely, especially the ceilings, and the grounds were spectacular with huge, colourful camilas and rhododendrons.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay, with a beautiful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked the lovely, narrow streets of Bellagio and saw Grand Hotel Villa Serbelloni with its gorgeous views. We found Gilardoni Alimentari Gastronomia where we bought fresh made ham and cheese sandwiches (€5,11) then walked to Chiesa di San Giacomo and sat in the sun enjoying our picnic lunch.
reviews.title: Simply the Best of the Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because our time in Varenna was short, we wanted something convenient and nice. Albergo Milano was that. The staff was very helpful, the room was fine. Part of the reason we stayed there was for the restaurant.
reviews.title: Quiet and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in Varenna for two nights and it was simply superb. We had a room on the first floor with a side view of the lake (room 3) but it was a pretty full view of the lake as you can see from the photos.
reviews.title: A charming hotel with character in a wonderful location.

reviews.text: The hotel staff are extremely friendly, as is the cat, and the overall feeling is one of a place to stay with real charm. We ate in the restaurant one night and had a fantastic meal; the menu was two choices per course but the food that was served was great and good value. If you see a dessert of cheese and honey, though, then that's literally what you get. The views from the restaurant are stunning, this hotel has a really good location and is elevated from the lakeside which helps. Breakfast was also good and offered a much wider selection than some of the other Italian hotels we've stayed in.
reviews.title: Unbelievable Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms are small, but fine, and I'd say they've done a great job of fitting out the bathroom in such a small space.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Varenna itself is one of the better places on Lake Como that we visited, it's a charming small town and is a great base for exploring the lake. We'd recommend the Villa Monastero gardens but were disappointed with the Villa Cipressi Hotel gardens. There's a small gelateria by the water side, La Giazzera, which is a great stop on the lakeside walkway between the ferry terminal and the town itself.
reviews.title: Albergo Milano - wonderful!!

description: Dolce Far Niente at the Albergo Milano, the Sweet Delight of Doing Nothing on Lake of Como will remain our credo for the time being... Besides the charmingly decorated rooms at the main house, Albergo Milano, we also offer comfortable accommodation at our new annexes Casa Rossa, the apartments Casa Gialla and Casa 3 Archi, perfect alternatives for an unforgettable stay in town.
